definition: to be successful in every endeavor
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
old variant of 往[wang3]
to go (in a direction)/to/towards/(of a train) bound for/past/previous
(negative prefix)/not/no
surname Li
sharp/favorable/advantage/benefit/profit/interest/to do good to/to benefit

sentences.english: He is nearly ever successful on the market, ever-victorious.
sentences.chinese: 他在商场上几乎无往不利，百战百胜。

sentences.english: Mandarin speakers can gain an advantage in doing business in China, he said.
sentences.chinese: 他说，在中国做生意，会讲汉语将无往不利。

definition: to sweep everything before one/to be invincible (idiom)
to be invincible/unrivalled
to triumph in every battle (idiom); invincible/to succeed in every undertaking
like a fish back in water (idiom); glad to be back in one's proper surroundings
to triumph in every battle and win every fight (idiom); all-conquering/ever victorious/nothing they can't do
pinyin: gong1 wu2 bu4 ke4 , zhan4 wu2 bu4 sheng4

definition: lit. what the heart wishes, the hand accomplishes (idiom) skilled at the job/entirely in one's element/going smoothly and easily
lit. like a tiger that has grown wings/with redoubled power (idiom)
handling a butcher's cleaver with ease (idiom); to do sth skillfully and easily
to emerge victorious in every battle/to be ever-victorious
to call the wind and summon the rain (idiom); to exercise magical powers/fig. to stir up troubles
no stronghold one cannot overcome (idiom); to conquer every obstacle/nothing one can't do/to carry everything before one
to win by a surprise move
stretch a hand and grab it (idiom); very easy
to handle matters with ease (idiom)/to hold one's own
like a hot knife through butter (idiom)/with irresistible force
total annihilation
